snippet: A raid in Saxony led to the arrest of five people suspected of attacking refugee shelters, and the trial of an anti-immigrant group leader began.
abstract: German authorities conduct raid in Eastern state of Saxony against members of anti-immigrant group Pegida, which is suspected of carrying out attacks on refugee shelters in Dresden; trial against group's leader Lutz Bachmann on charges of incitement opens in Dresden.

byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and MELISSA EDDY

lead_paragraph: A raid in Saxony led to the arrest of five people suspected of attacking refugee shelters, and the trial of an anti-immigrant group leader began.

headline.main: Germany Cracks Down on Far Right With Arrests and a Trial
headline.print_headline: Germany Cracks Down on Far-Right Groups With Arrests and a Trial

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
